explains: v. （使）解开，（使）松开；弄清，阐明；崩溃，失败

sentences.en: He could unravel a knot that others wouldn't even attempt.
sentences.cn: 他能解开其他人甚至不敢尝试的绳结。

sentences.en: It just so happened that while she was sipping some tea, one of the cocoons that she had collected landed in the hot tea and started to unravel into a fine thread.
sentences.cn: 事情是这样的，当她喝着茶的时候，她收集的一个蚕茧落在热茶里，然后蚕茧开始散开，变成了一根细线。

sentences.en: The discovery will help scientists unravel the mystery of the Ice Age.
sentences.cn: 这一发现将有助于科学家揭开冰川时代的奥秘。
